title: Tripadvisor to cut 20% of staff amid internal restructuring
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Tripadvisor plans to cut 20% of its workforce as it merges operations with its Viator brand to streamline operations.
The restructuring includes an $85 million cost-savings program and aims to focus on AI and experience-driven growth.
This change comes amid pressure from activist investor Starboard Value, which holds a 9% stake in Tripadvisor.

title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: An abandoned tent was discovered at Valley Way tent site in New Hampshire's White Mountains on October 26.
A hiker reported the tent with wet gear and uneaten food; no missing person reports were filed related to it.
Car keys with an Apple AirTag were found at the site, but no matching vehicle was located at nearby trailheads.

title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, former Patriots cheerleader and founder of CharityTeams, passed away at 62 on November 1, 2025.
CharityTeams, founded by Hurley in 2008, helped raise $42 million for nonprofits through athletic fundraising events.
A Celebration of Life for Susan Hurley will be held on November 8 at Waters Church in Norwood, Massachusetts.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket launched 'More For Your Dollar' beer, a collaboration with Zero Gravity Beer from Vermont.
The beer is available at MB Spirits, MB Beer & Wine locations in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire.
The 12-pack of the lager costs $12.99 and features the Market Basket logo and colors.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: SJC is considering involvement in Massachusetts public defender pay dispute affecting over 900 defendants without representation.
Massachusetts public defenders initiated work stoppage in May demanding increased pay; Legislature approved a $20 hourly raise in August.
SJC heard arguments on whether judges can grant pay raises; decision could take months, with concerns about separation of powers.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston for a book signing and private dinner.
Witherspoon co-authored the New York Times bestselling thriller 'Gone Before Goodbye' with Harlan Coben.
She spoke at Harvard Business School promoting her novel and business, Reese’s Book Club, during her visit.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: GOP lawmakers demand accountability from Gov. Maura Healey after aide LaMar Cook's cocaine trafficking arrest raises vetting concerns.
Cook, former deputy director in Healey's Western Massachusetts office, was fired following his arrest linked to state office cocaine delivery.
Republican leaders call for an independent investigation into state's hiring practices and criticize Healey's leadership amid gubernatorial race.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, were killed in a New Bedford crash on Route 140.
The crash involved a 2019 Honda Civic with three occupants, including an 18-year-old driver treated for non-life-threatening injuries.
A GoFundMe for Siqueira's funeral expenses raised nearly $26,000, exceeding its goal within two days.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police seek public help to identify suspect in downtown commercial burglaries since August 21.
The suspect allegedly used a pry tool to steal cash, credit cards, and electronics like cameras.
Photos released; similar crimes reported by Boston University, Cambridge, and Northeastern University police.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Titans owner reportedly unwilling to trade with Patriots due to past with coach Mike Vrabel.
Mike Vrabel previously coached Titans to a winning record over six seasons before his firing in 2023.
Current Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk cited organizational changes for parting with Vrabel as head coach.
